revised_title: Further Analysis of Motor Cortex Stimulation in Macacus Sinicus
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on a monkey (Macacus sinicus) to further analyze the effects of electric stimulation on the so-called motor region of the cortex cerebri. They investigated the movements evoked by stimulating different areas of the cortex, including the posterior third of the frontal convolutions, the upper third of the ascending frontal convolution, the superior parietal lobule, and the posterior half of the ascending parietal convolution. Their research aimed to complete the investigation of the upper part of the excitable region of the outer convex surface of the hemisphere.
